title: About
text: I defended my PhD on January 8th, with a dissertation examining the replicability and reproducibility of research in sports and exercise science. I am currently a Postdoctoral Researcher at Eindhoven University of Technology, where I conduct meta-science research. My current work focuses on Metacheck, an R package designed to help researchers prevent common statistical and reporting errors, promote best research practices, and extract data from published studies. I collaborate on this project with Daniël Lakens and Lisa DeBruine. My main responsibility is the development of the power analysis module and the validation of all Metacheck modules. In addition to my research, I teach quantitative research methods, including multiple regression, power analysis, and meta-analysis.

title: Do sports scientsits know the hypothesis they are testing?
Welcome To My Blog
text: This blog website is currently under construction as I am busy finishing up my PhD thesis. This blog will feature content on a range of topics, including sports and exercise science research, methods and statistics, and metascience.

title: linear interaction effect
text:
library(ggplot2)

Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.4.3

library(interflex)

Linear Interaction Effect

n <- 200 # sample
i <- 5 # intercept
t <- sample(c(0,1), n, replace = TRUE) # treatment
x <- rnorm(n, 3, 1) # moderator
e <- rnorm(n, 0, 1) # error term
y <- i + 2*x + 2*t + 5*x*t + e # linear model

df1 <- data.frame(y, t, x, e)

head(df1, 5)

          y t        x         e
1 24.305802 1 2.322554 1.0479211
2 14.669438 0 4.343127 0.9831833
3  9.118423 0 1.998837 0.1207495
4 28.841809 1 3.025760 0.6614884
5 12.800494 0 2.737633 2.3252282



ggplot(df1, aes(y = y, x = x)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  facet_wrap(t)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'










m1 <- lm(y ~ t*x, df1)

summary(m1)


Call:
lm(formula = y ~ t * x, data = df1)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-2.55691 -0.63517 -0.01408  0.59504  2.87810 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)   4.9696     0.3633  13.679  < 2e-16 ***
t             2.6722     0.4790   5.579 7.96e-08 ***
x             1.9540     0.1141  17.120  < 2e-16 ***
t:x           4.9004     0.1499  32.691  < 2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.9415 on 196 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9915,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.9914 
F-statistic:  7645 on 3 and 196 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16



interflex(estimator = "raw", Y = "y", D = "t", X = "x", data = df1, 
          weights = NULL, Ylabel = "Outcome", 
          Dlabel = "Treatment", Xlabel="Moderator", 
          main = "Raw Plot", cex.main = 1.2, ncols=2)

Baseline group not specified; choose treat = 0 as the baseline group. 


Warning: `aes_string()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.0.0.
ℹ Please use tidy evaluation idioms with `aes()`.
ℹ See also `vignette("ggplot2-in-packages")` for more information.
ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the interflex package.
  Please report the issue to the authors.


Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the interflex package.
  Please report the issue to the authors.










out1 <- interflex(estimator = "binning", Y = "y", D = "t", X = "x", data = df1, 
          weights = NULL, Ylabel = "Outcome", 
          Dlabel = "Treatment", Xlabel="Moderator", 
          main = "Raw Plot", cex.main = 1.2, ncols=2)

Baseline group not specified; choose treat = 0 as the baseline group. 


Warning: `aes_()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.0.0.
ℹ Please use tidy evaluation idioms with `aes()`
ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the ggplotify package.
  Please report the issue at
  <https://github.com/GuangchuangYu/ggplotify/issues>.

out1$figure









out1$tests$p.wald

[1] "0.976"


Non-linear Interaction Effect

n <- 200 # sample
i <- 5 # intercept
t <- sample(c(0,1), n, replace = TRUE) # treatment
x <- rnorm(n, 3, 1) # moderator
e <- rnorm(n, 0, 1) # error term
y <- i + (2*x^3-1) + 2*t + 50*x*t + e # non-linear model

df2 <- data.frame(y, t, x, e)


ggplot(df2, aes(y = y, x = x)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  facet_wrap(t)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'










interflex(estimator = "raw", Y = "y", D = "t", X = "x", data = df2, 
          weights = NULL, Ylabel = "Outcome", 
          Dlabel = "Treatment", Xlabel="Moderator", 
          main = "Raw Plot", cex.main = 1.2, ncols=2)

Baseline group not specified; choose treat = 0 as the baseline group. 










out2 <- interflex(estimator = "binning", Y = "y", D = "t", X = "x", data = df2, 
          weights = NULL, Ylabel = "Outcome", 
          Dlabel = "Treatment", Xlabel="Moderator", 
          main = "Raw Plot", cex.main = 1.2, ncols=2)

Baseline group not specified; choose treat = 0 as the baseline group. 

out2$figure









out2$tests$p.wald

[1] "0.000"

title: Employment
